summary: Texas is the second largest state in the United States.
full_text:
Paint Rock is a town in and the county seat of Concho County, Texas, United States. The population was 273 at the 2010 census, down from 320 at the 2010 census.
The town's name comes from Indian pictographs painted on cliffs overlooking the nearby Concho River. These pictographs cover nearly half a mile upstream from the town of Paint Rock. Some of the pictures painted on the rocks include animals, human figures, and handprints.

^ "US Board on Geographic Names". United States Geological Survey. 2007-10-25. Retrieved 2008-01-31. 
^ "Find a County". National Association of Counties. Retrieved 2011-06-07. 
^ "Geographic Identifiers: 2010 Census Summary File 1 : Paint Rock town, Texas". U.S. Census Bureau, American Factfinder. Retrieved August 4, 2015. 
^ "Paint Rock Pictographs". Retrieved 2011-12-26.
title: Paint Rock, Texas
